programName: Cognitive Science with Specialization in Neuroscience (B.S.)
fullProgramDescription: The Cognitive Science with Specialization in Neuroscience major is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the cognitive processes and their neural basis. The program combines coursework in cognitive science, neuroscience, and related fields to provide a foundation for a variety of careers or further study.
shortProgramDescription: The Cognitive Science with Specialization in Neuroscience major provides a comprehensive education in the cognitive processes and their neural basis, preparing students for careers or further study.
classHighlights: The major requires a set of core courses in cognitive science, including COGS101A, COGS101B, COGS107A, COGS107B, and COGS108. These courses provide a foundation in the principles of cognitive science, including perception, attention, memory, language, and decision-making.

Students also complete a set of required courses in neuroscience, including COGS100/PSY101, COGS108, and NEU/MCDB100. These courses provide a foundation in the principles of neuroscience, including the structure and function of the nervous system.

In addition to the core and required courses, students complete a set of elective courses that provide a deeper understanding of the cognitive processes and their neural basis. These electives include courses in cognitive neuroscience, neuroplasticity, and neurophysiology.

The major also includes a set of upper-division writing courses, including COGS189, which provide students with the opportunity to develop their writing skills and apply their knowledge to real-world problems.
learningOutcomes: Understand the principles of cognitive science and their application to real-world problems.
Understand the structure and function of the nervous system and its role in cognitive processes.
Apply knowledge of cognitive science and neuroscience to the analysis of complex problems.
Communicate complex ideas and research findings effectively in written and oral form.
Evaluate the strengths and limitations of different theoretical approaches and methodologies in cognitive science and neuroscience.
additionalInformation: The major requires a minimum GPA of2.0 and completion of all required and elective courses. Students are encouraged to participate in research and internship opportunities to gain practical experience.
